item.title: Is Linux Growing Out of All Proportion?
item.description: As of October 1st, the Linux kernel source¹ is comprised of over 22 million lines of code (excludes comments, blank lines)². In the past 15 years that figure has increased an average of over 10% per year. At this rate, it will reach 50 million lines of code by 2030. If you studied 2,000 lines of kernel source code per day, you’d never catch up. So is the kernel growing out of all proportion?
